reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007
reviews.text: Mum (late 50's) and daughter (late 30's) on whirlwind tour for 3 days.....
reviews.title: Good base for true Roman tourism trudging

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked directly on their website, then rang for a discount....that worked but make sure you don't end up with an inferior room because of it (we didn't but I'm in the trade and know what to say!). Rooms are clean and spacious and decoration is modern. Noise is an issue with the laminate flooring at night with people returning after a few vinos and unfortunately there was a distinct lack of drawers and cupboard space despite the size of the room! No "door hangers" for fluffy robes and wet coats etc! odd.... but still a nice base and a lovely bar (the glass) to crash into at night when your are sight weary and in need of a good stiff drink! Walking distance to Trevi (10 minutes max), Vatican (35mins) Colosseum (15 mins max)....which give you an idea of its central location. It does not serve food in the evening at the moment so venture out and visit the local restaurants.......out of hotel, turn right, cross the road and head down the little side street opposite the hotels' corner and down a dingy street you will find restaurant abruzzo.... filled with noisy, singing joyous priests tucking into lots of vino tinto and excellent roast lamb and rosemary roasted potatoes! A sight to behold! Breakfasts are good with usual continental fayre..... don't use the coffee machine though..... ask the waitress for a capuccino / espresso and they are infinately better than the machine "pods"! Within wobbling distance home from several bars too which is good! Would stay again here. Staff friendly....
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Rome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Best Hotel in Rome! I booked the Cosmopolita based on the reviews at Tripadvisor and have never been so happy with a hotel. The location can't be beat - 5 minutes stroll to the Forum, 10 minutes to Trevi Fountain, 15 minutes to Spanish Steps, Pantheon, Colisseum. We took a taxi to St Peter's and then walked back to the hotel after our tour. We walked to the Trevi Fountain each night after dinner and "people watched".
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were truly nice and helpful. They answered any questions always with a smile. Breakfast was excellent. Lots of selection - cereals, fruit, sliced meats, cheese, eggs, sausage, yogurt, croissants, rolls, juices and an espresso machine that let you make your own choice of caffe, american coffee, hot chocolate or tea.
reviews.title: Excellent location!

likes.disliked: — The noise form traffic and people walking past the room

reviews.title: excellent location
reviews.text: I loved the fluffy robes and slippers provided! The toiletries were good quality and they offered misc. items (toothbrush etc.) if you had forgotten them.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 wonderful nights which I bought on hotelclub.com (all I could get at the time) at a terrific rate. Cosmopolita spoilt us for anything else particularly when staying around the corner at the Pace Hotel.The rooms at the Cosmopolita were cool, clean and with timber floors and nicely decorated which was like an oasis coming in from the busy streets of Rome.
reviews.title: Classy and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Both hotels had rooftop gardens but Cosmopolita had bar service which Pace did not. Pace hotel is tired and the rooms are fairly shabby. Pace certainly did not keep up with the pace particularly when both hotels cost the same money!
reviews.title: Good location, helpful staff

likes.disliked: — Small rooms and showers, no tubs, small breakfast room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was some construction going on in the hotel when we arrived but they were surprising quiet. The staff were most helpful with directions and other concerns we had. Rooms are on the small size with no views and small showers. Location is terrific if you want to be close to the Coliseum, ruins, Trevi and about a 15-20 minute walk to Pantheon. Rome is extremely busy and there is a lot of road construction. This was the last city we were in, after Venice and Florence, and it was the most spread out with a tremendous amount of walking. However taxi's are plentiful and not too expensive. If we did this again, I would chose a hotel with larger rooms, more views, and a tub as we really needed to relax after the walking or put Rome first on your itinerary when you have the energy.
reviews.title: Smart and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can wholeheartedly recommend this wonderful hotel. It's smart and very clean with plenty of character. The location couldn't be better since it's right in the middle of all the main attractions. Trevi Fountain is just 5mins away, a bit further takes you to the Spanish Steps or the Pantheon. Go in the opposite direction and you can visit the Roman Forum and Colloseum in a leisurely stroll. The Vatican is a good 20-30min walk, but there is a bus and I think the metro can get you thereabouts.
reviews.title: Friendliest Staff Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated between two very busy streets that you need to cross each time you leave the hotel on foot, but this is common in Rome, and there are plenty of crossing points. A small price to pay for being so near to everything. Once inside the hotel you don't even notice the traffic rumbling by outside, even the rooftop terrace is peaceful. This itself is like an oasis of tranquility! From 5pm each day you can choose snacks and drinks from the bar including some really good cocktails and the best coffee we had anywhere. The friendly barman knows how to make fantastic Cafe Latte and cocktails that's for sure! A great place to retreat to after a hectic day of sightseeing. Not a bad view either!
reviews.title: good central hotel

likes.disliked: — breakfast room was a little dark and dreary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We loved this hotel. It was very clean and well appointed. The rooms were small for American standards, but not bad at all for European standards. The bathroom was definately on the small side.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a terrific location and is withing walking distance of practically everything. We actually ended up walking to the Vatican from here. It was a long, unintended walk, but we went to the Campo D'Fiori first, spent time there, and then ended up walking the rest of the way to the Vatican. We were very close to every thing else.
reviews.title: great Cosmopolita

likes.liked: — overall quality of hotel; no surprises.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and accomodating. They were very helpful with dinner reservations as well.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Cosmopolita.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was certainly decent; many choices of hot and cold items. The hotel also had a nice lounge which was great for a night cap.
reviews.title: Over Rated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definately stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Loved it loved it loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent hotel. Got upgraded after email request. Shower small but OK. In the centre of historic area - walking distance of all sites except Vatican. Good service, friendly staff. Good breakfast. Lack of restaurant not a problem as restaurants nearby. Recommend especially Ristorante Abruzzia and Marios. Very good and memorable visit to Rome. However beware the No 64 bus - a mecca for pickpockets!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you want a hotel that is within yards of historic Rome and that is clean cheerful and value for money then stay at the Cosmopolita. The rooms and bathrooms are not luxurious but are more than adequate. The immediate surroundings of The Forum, Plaza Venezia and Via Corsa give you all the faces of Rome, yet when you are tired your room is just around the corner.
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from two nights in Rome at the Cosmpolita. Our room (a triple) was very clean and comfortable and the bathroom was much better than I expected after reading previous reviews. Very clean and plenty big enough. The breakfast in particular was excellent. The hotel is in an ideal location if you want to walk to all of the sights. We walked to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and the Spanish Steps. The Vatican was the furthest we walked at approx 25 - 30 minutes. - A very nice hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, Very central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: Like previous reviewers, I agree that the hotel has a great location for visiting the main sites even the Vatican. Room was a superior double and was comfortable although the beds are a bit on the hard side. Overall a bit pricey for what it was. Not sure about the escape routes in a fire which was a concern given there was construction going on downstairs. Seemed to be only one staircase and this was small and in the centre of the building. However on the plus side, the hotel is clean and the breakfast is more than adequate. Would recommend but would not be over enthusiastic about it either.
reviews.title: Good base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: Perhaps Rome, and Italy generally, allocates stars differently to what you'd expect elsewhere, but I really don't think this is a 4 star hotel, or worth the price we paid.
reviews.title: Not worth 4 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When in Rome, do as we do....stay at the Hotel Cosmopolita. The location is absolutely perfect. The Hotel is just off Piazza Venizia, less than a 15 minute walk to:
reviews.title: When In Rome, do as we do....
very nice hotel
reviews.text: - Colosseum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Roman Forum
reviews.title: Very nice hotel and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Trevi Fountain,
reviews.title: Great location, Poor service
Amazing!
reviews.text: - Campo di Fiori

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally the hotel is nice.
reviews.title: Generally nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel is its location.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: Very central and everything in walking distance. Even the vatican is in walking distance.
reviews.title: Walk Everywhere
great location
reviews.text: People working there are nice and helpfull. The rooms are nice but i can´t say they are that clean. If you look under the bed and corners you will see a lot of dust.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also two times the cleaning lady forgot to give us toilet paper but aftert complaining at the front desk everything was ok.
reviews.title: Comfortable and unbeatable location!
Great Location
reviews.text: This hotel delivers efficiently what it promises. It is centrally located to the historic sites – Trevi Fountain, Forum, Coliseum and Pantheon are all within 20 minutes walk. The Forum is no more than 200 yards away. The rooms are well maintained and clean and the included breakfast is good. Security is tightly controlled with interior hallway cameras and card key access to the bedroom area.

reviews.title: Problems with A/C was a big problem
reviews.text: We stayed here in August 2007 and offer a few notes:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Don’t forget your roomcard when leaving the room – you need it to get access to the lobby.
reviews.title: Great hotel. Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The elevator is actually a roasting oven attached to the side of the building. It has almost no ventilation and heats up directly in the summer sun.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: -The television has one English channel. But did you really come to Rome to watch TV?
reviews.title: Convenient to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had to write as we have just enjoyed a great three night stay at The Cosmopolita. The location as every one has said is excellent. The rooms are comfortable and although I know one floor had problems with the Air Con whilst we were there, it didn't detract from an excellent stay. The roof top bar was a great place to relax in the evening, after a days touring or following the long walk back from the Genesis concert at Circus Maximus. The restaurant was a real find. Excellent food, excellent price. For those who complain about the bathroom size - welcome too europe! I must admit that I spend my time visiting the city, not the smallest room ( to coin a phrase) Would recommend this hotel and will def be back.
reviews.title: Great stay at Cosmopolita
Fabulous Hotel / Perfect Location - Loved it!
reviews.text: This quaint hotel is on a quiet street with wonderful staff. Bathrooms were a little tight, but it was a single room so maybe the doubles are a little bigger. Everything was wonderful and we were in walking distance to just about everything in ancient Rome. I'm going back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was very centrally located. Granite bar, sink-very clean. Very small room and bath. Internet, fresh hot breakfast. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — Rome sized small rooms and baths

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is ideally placed for your trip in the City.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Forum 5 mins
reviews.title: creeky floors/dark room
